text: Keg at Brasseur du Temps, Gatineau.  Hazy deep amber, small head Floral nose. Dry with light body and clean mouthfeel. Some cookies, notes of raisiny malt. Light floral hops. Mid bitter finish. Pretty good for 2.4%.

[Draught at the brewpub] Pours a deep orange-amber with an average size semi-lasting frothy white head. Mild aroma of caramel malt, lightly bready, and with some light piney hops. Slightly watery flavour of caramel malt and piney hops. Average bodied. Pretty good, and flavourful for that low abv, but Id like there to be more to it.

Taster on tap at the 2015 Festival Bière et Saveur in Chambly, Québec. Dark gold, small head. Sweet citrus hop aroma, a bit of pine notes. Dry hoppy black tea taste, with a bit of pine, good bitterness. You know its a good brewery when a less than 3% beer is flavorful!

Draught @ the brewpub (3 oclock). Pours clear rich amber with small off-white head. Mild aroma of malt and fruit, with subtle notes of caramel and hops. Bitter, hoppy flavour with notes of malt and touches of yeast and fruit. Bitter aftertaste. Low carbonation. Decent for the style but the style itself is not very inspiring.

Une bière très mince et plutôt foncée pour son style (elle est présentée comme étant une Session IPA). Couleur acajou, belle mousse dérable en surface, nez de sapins et de fruits tropicaux. En bouche elle confirme son extrême minceur, mais les saveurs, puissantes, sont au rendez-vous : notes fruitées (abricot), caramélisées, amertume coriace, finale très sèche. Bien faite, aucun compromis sur les saveurs, le tout est vite descendu.

Draught: Poured a clear light copper color ale with a nice off-white foamy head. Aroma of light dry caramel malt with light dry hoppy notes is pleasant. Taste is dominated by dry caramel malt notes with some light dry hoppy notes. Body is light with OK carbonation. Pretty well brewed for style.

Glass, 12 ounces, draught, on the premise, savoured on January 14 2015; eye: caramel with a reddish hue, clear, no effervescence, thin sheet of beige head, good lacing; nose: hops, light pine, citrusy, grapefruit; mouth: hops, light pine, citrusy, grapefruit, dry finale in pine with presence of grapefruit, medium body, good carbonation, surprisingly bitter, slick texture; overall: fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Verre, 12 onces, en fût, bue sur place, savourée le 14 janvier 2015; il : caramel avec une teinte rougeâtre, limpide, pas deffervescence, mince couverture de mousse beige, bonne dentelle; nez : houblon, léger pin, citrique, pamplemousse; bouche : houblon, léger, pin, citrique, pamplemousse, finale sèche en pin avec présence de pamplemousse, corps moyen, bonne carbonatation, curieusement amère, texture coulante; en résumé : bien

En cask à la brasserie. Belle robe cuivrée et coiffée dun col crémeux et de couleur blanc cassé. Arôme malté/houblonné bien équilibré et assorti de quelques notes boisées et herbacées. En bouche, les saveurs houblonnées dominent légèrement. On décèle aussi des nuances de malt de pin et de grain. Longue finale amère et sèche. Très bien.

On tap at the brewpub. Clear dark amber with a frothy off-white head. Flavors are biscuit, toasted cereals, garlic, tea, leaves and citrus with herbal and floral notes. Light body, soft carbonation, watery texture.

Amber pour. White head. The nose is softly spicy with some slight malt
sweetness as well. A bit of pine and some herbal flavour with a touch
of resin as well as a lingering caramel malt finish. Very flavourful
for the 2.4% ABV

Aroma:perfume and spicy...
Appearance:Amber, light head..
Flavo:Spicy, floral....

En fût, cask. Verre de 10 oz dégusté chez Vices & Versa (Montréal, QC) au coût de 5,25$. Arôme: Odeur dagrumes avec une pointe de céréales. Apparence: La couleur est orangée-ambrée. Présence dun large col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Léger goût dagrumes avec une pointe de céréales grillées. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement aqueuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement houblonné. (Rating #6211)

Nice beer! Pours copper, clear lots of frothy head and tons of lacing. Nose is a bit dusty and some grassy. Flavours of pine, grapefruit, some cereal. Taste medium bitter light sweet. Light body with a pretty aggressive bitterness in finish. Well done for size.
En fût à la korrigane. Ambrée. Douce. Fine amertume. Malt grillé. Noix. Florale/savon. Finale sèche et amère. Très bien. Super bon compromis goût et faible en alcool.

on tap at la korrigane, qc. unclear bright golden orange pour with a creamy off-white cap offering good retention and sticky lacing. oranges and leafy grassiness, marmelade with added quinine, toasted grains, fruitiness - peppery berries, chewy caramel, coffee grinds and dirt, herbal-grassiness. average to light carbonation, light body - excredibly smooth and non-watery mouthfeel for its abv; balanced earthy-herbal-grassy-citrusy finish. almost a tour de force in its genre.

Amber color, with a thick fluffy beige head, with a mild earthy grainy toasted, pale, munich malt, herbal tea, tobacco leaf, lemon rind nose, with a nice herbal floral tea, citrus, leafy, grassy, spicy hop accent in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a crisp earthy herbal, spicy flowery leafy, fruity, citrus hoppy character, with some tobacco leaf, zesty lemon, lime peel, faint lemon marmalade, tea leaf, peachy, light grainy earthy pale, toasted, caramel malt flavours, leading towards a tea, tobacco leaf, lemon, citrusy rind, lingering citrus, leafy, minty hop bitterness finish.

A hazed golden amber session ipa with a thin frothy lacing off white head. In aroma, nice biscuit malt with herbaceous floral hops, grapefruit pulp, catnip, very nice. In mouth, a smooth grassy biscuit malt with grassy floral hops, light and refreshing, well done. On tap at brewery.

Sampled at the brewpub. The waitress said something about the kegs, but not sure what. When I got my sample, it had a creamy warm cap so I asked if this was nitro, and was told no. Wow... I do like this creamy head and adds a lot to a low alcohol brew. Clean amber, good retention and some creamy-sticky lacing. Mild citrus aromas, very light grain. The taste is stronger with the grain and the hops that stand out more. Hard to taste the difference between this very low alcohol beer and some of the normal American Pale Ales out there. A great session !

En fût au BDT. Couleur ambrée pâle, mousse blanche mince mais persistante. Arôme dherbes, agrumes et de grains...un peu de toffee. En bouche, une touche de caramel, houblons Nugget, du grains. Goût exceptionnel pour 2.4%. On en boit une pinte (ou deux) sans remords !
Couleur dorée avec un col assez résistant. Aromes dagrumes, caramel, un peu de résine, herbes, floral. Interessante bière pour garder la tete haute!

My Bottom Line:
Polished honeyed malts surround this Bitters leafy and fruity hops for a silky and smooth pint.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A creamy head of foam laces all the way down the shiny pale amber. This has dropped clear beautifully. 
-This local Nugget crop is a fine one and works wonderfully with the chosen grain bill.
-The mouthfeel is lusciously velvety and easygoing for a 2% brew. Needless to say, this goes down effortlessly.
-Hop fruitiness is reminiscent of oranges and flowers.
-This needs to be brewed very often. OK, guys?

On cask at the brewpub.
